bioghist.p: Ernest Edwin Logan is a Presbyterian minister. He received his BD in theology from New College, Edinburgh, and a Master's of Education from the University of Pittsburgh. In the 1970s he was an associate pastor of First Presbyterian Church of Pittsburgh. He is the author of two histories of First Church, entitled The Church that Was Twice Born: A History of the First Presbyterian Church of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, 1773-1973 and The Church that Kept on Being Born Again.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of reference material for Logan's book The Church that was Twice Born. Materials are primarily photocopies of diaries, book chapters, newspaper clippings, magazine articles, and other printed materials, annotated with Logan's notes. There are a few original newspaper and magazine clippings.
